DOC.brief_summary: Type 2 diabetes common among Native Hawaiians Pacific Peoples . Diabetes related complication decrease quality life result early morbidity . The purpose Partners Care diabetes self-management educational intervention teach participant manage diabetes avoid delay diabetes-related complication well work health care team .
DOC.detailed_description: This feasibility study use randomize control trial ( RCT ) design 100 Native Hawaiians ( NHs ) Pacific Islanders ( PPs ) randomize either 3-month diabetes self-management group ( DSMG ; N=50 ) delay intervention control group ( CG ; N=50 ) . Participants DSMG receive culturally-tailored , group diabetes self-management education deliver community set train community peer educator . To meet objective , partner four community-based organization : 1 ) Hawai ` Maoli Association Hawaiian Civic Clubs , 2 ) Ke Ola Mamo Native Hawaiian Health Care System , 3 ) Kokua Kalihi Valley Comprehensive Family Services , 4 ) Kula No NƒÅ Po ` e Hawai ` . These four organization provide service large number Pacific People include , limited , Native Hawaiians , Samoans , Filipinos , Chuukese . They already intervention research experience member PILI 'Ohana CBPR Project . The 3-month face-to-face intervention community-based community-led train community peer educator four partner community organization . Individuals hemoglobin A1c ( HbA1c ; average blood sugar level ) > =8 % recruit study represent at-risk diabetes-related complication . Over 1-year accrual period , community partner recruit enroll 100 eligible NHs PPs ( 25 participant per participate community ) , well deliver evaluate intervention respective community setting . The primary outcome study hemoglobin A1c self-reported diabetes specific quality life . Secondary outcome cholesterol level ( include HDL , LDL , total cholesterol , triglyceride ) , blood pressure , body mass index , psychosocial adaptation .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Selfreported Native Hawaiian , Filipino , Pacific Islander ethnic background , 2 . Adults age > =18 year , 3 . Englishspeaking , 4 . Physiciandiagnosed type 2 diabetes , 5 . Baseline hemoglobin A1c > =8 % 1 . Survival le 6 month , 2 . Planning move island state study period , 3 . Pregnancy , 4 . Any comorbid condition ( physical mental disability ) would prevent individual participate intervention protocol ( i.e. , major psychiatric illness ) .
